thread.title: Footy legend reveals gross, botched surgery
thread.title_full: Footy legend reveals gross, botched surgery

title: Footy legend reveals gross, botched surgery
text:
HAWTHORN legend Dermott Brereton has shared an early contender for most haunting video of the year. 
The Fox Footy analyst and commentator posted a confronting video of his botched shoulder reconstruction operation. 
Brereton told SEN’s The Run Home , his left shoulder was operated on in December, but the surgery needed to be performed a second time two weeks ago because he had re-injured the joint in recovery. 
The 14-season veteran of the VFL and AFL’s shoulder was a car crash after two rounds of surgery and also appeared to be battling infection after the second operation. 
He said he was forced to several times a day try and manually drain the cut at the point of surgical incision. 
“I had my shoulder reconstructed in December,” he told SEN. 
“Yeah, the puss ain’t great. I probably did a bit too much with it too early and consequently went in to have all the garbage flushed out two Mondays ago and they’d found I’d torn it all up again so we started back at square one two Mondays ago.” Dermott Brereton on a happier day.   
Stunned by the amount of puss he was forced to drain following the operation, Brereton filmed a video on his mobile phone of him squeezing the blemish and shared it on social media. 
Like any trainwreck, it is difficult to look away. 
“That was one of about 20 times I had to squeeze the puss out of it,” he said. 
“It actually turned into a bit of a game.” 
That’s not a game many people would ever want to play. WARNING – GRAPHIC CONTENT! Oh Derm... #SENFooty pic.twitter.com/37oIBWp8ln — SEN 1116 (@SENNews) February 15, 2017 
In the video, Brereton swears like a sailor as he tries to come to terms with the scene of horror. 
“F***ing hell,” he said. 
“Is this s*** ever going to stop coming out of me?” 
He even moves the camera to briefly hover over the sink full of puss and body fluid.” 
Fortunately, the popular broadcaster has confirmed he will be physically able to continue his footy commentary roles with Fox Footy and SEN this year. Fitzpatrick trolled by journo 0:21 
AFL: Outgoing AFL chairman and former Carlton player Mike Fitzpatrick was asked a cheeky question in his press conference. February 15th 2017
